returns._0: Number of eligible verifiers (power > 0, not banned)
True if verifier has power > 0 and is not banned

isConsumingScheduledOp().details: Returns true only in the context of a delayed restricted call, at the moment that the scheduled operation is being consumed. Prevents denial of service for delayed restricted calls in the case that the contract performs attacker controlled calls.

reportFraud(uint256,uint256,address[],st.details: This replaces the old bond slashing mechanism

params.engagementId: Engagement ID where fraud was detected
params.offenders: Array of juror addresses that voted incorrectly

params.panelSize: Total number of jurors to select (N)
params.useWeighting: Whether to use VPT amounts as weights in selection

setAuthority(address).details: Transfers control to a new authority. The caller must be the current authority.

getEligibleVerifierCount(uint256).notice: Get eligible verifier count for a community

getSelectedJurors(uint256).notice: Get selected jurors for an engagement

hasVerifierPower(address,uint256).notice: Check if address has verifier power for community

reportFraud(uint256,uint256,address[],st.notice: Report fraud and initiate governance process for banning

selectJurors(uint256,uint256,uint256,uin.notice: Select M jurors from N available verifiers using VPT eligibility
